title: Will a lower court's ruling against the U.S. Education Department's student loan repayment plan be reinstated by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a lower court's ruling against the U.S. Education Department's student loan repayment plan is reinstated, overturning the federal appeals court's decision to allow the plan to proceed. The reinstatement must be confirmed through official court documents and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If the lower court's ruling is not reinstated by the specified date, or if the appeals court's decision remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, this question refers to the plan that aims to lower monthly payments for millions of student loan borrowers, which was previously halted by a lower court but subsequently allowed to proceed by a federal appeals court.

article_information.article_description: A federal appeals court has allowed the U.S. Education Department to move ahead with a plan to lower monthly payments for millions of student loan borrowers, putting on hold a ruling last week by a lower court. The ruling from the 10th U.S. Circuit Court of A…

title: Will Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment, the parent company of Redbox, successfully exits Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection by July 31, 2024. A successful exit must be confirmed by official court documents or public statements from the company, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The exit must involve a court-approved reorganization plan or a similar resolution that allows the company to continue operations outside of bankruptcy protection. If no such exit is confirmed by July 31, 2024, or if the company's bankruptcy case is converted to Chapter 7 or dismissed without a successful reorganization, the question will resolve as NO.

The bankruptcy filing comes after months of a series of financial struggles for the company and piling unpaid bills. Chicken Sou…

title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a referendum on the topic of abortion rights in relation to the state constitution. The referendum must be officially announced by the Colorado state government and reported by at least three major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The specific wording or outcome of the referendum does not affect the resolution of this question. If no such referendum occurs or is officially scheduled by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights in its state constitution?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a referendum on enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be a formal, state-sanctioned vote open to eligible Florida voters. For a YES resolution, the referendum must specifically address the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution, not just general abortion-related policies. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government sources or reports from at least three major, reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or Florida-based newspapers of record). If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Maryland hold a referendum on abortion rights in its state constitution?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Maryland officially conducts a referendum on enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be a formal, state-sanctioned vote open to eligible Maryland voters. For a YES resolution, the referendum must specifically address the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution, not just general abortion-related legislation. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government sources or reports from at least three major, reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum meeting these criteria takes place by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Nevada hold a referendum on abortion rights in its state constitution?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nevada officially conducts a referendum on enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. For a positive resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Nevada state government and reported by at least three major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The referendum must specifically address the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. If no such referendum occurs or is officially scheduled to occur by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note that merely proposing or discussing such a referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the referendum must be officially scheduled or have taken place.

title: Will South Dakota hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, South Dakota officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically addressing the topic of abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be verified by official state sources or reported by at least three major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The exact wording or outcome of the referendum is not relevant for this question's resolution, only that it takes place and is specifically about abortion rights in relation to the state constitution. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Steve Bannon be released from federal prison by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Steve Bannon is confirmed to have been released from federal prison by July 31, 2024, after serving his sentence for contempt charges. The release must be verified through official records or announcements from the prison or legal authorities, and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If Bannon is released earlier than expected due to legal appeals, good behavior, or other reasons, the question still resolves as YES. If no confirmation of his release is available by the resolution date, or if he is still in prison, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the EU initiate new legal proceedings against Meta Platforms by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the European Union (EU) officially initiates new legal proceedings against Meta Platforms (formerly Facebook) regarding its digital competition practices. The legal action must be separate from and additional to any existing proceedings as of October 1, 2023. To qualify, the new legal action must be: 1. Officially announced by an authorized EU body (such as the European Commission or European Court of Justice). 2. Reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). 3. Specifically targeted at Meta Platforms' digital competition practices, which may include but are not limited to issues related to user data handling, market dominance, or compliance with EU digital regulations. The question will resolve as NO if no such additional legal action meeting these criteria is initiated by the EU against Meta Platforms by the specified date. Informal investigations, warnings, or statements of intent that do not constitute formal legal proceedings will not qualify for a YES resolution.

title: Will Boeing announce any delays in its planned acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Boeing publicly announces any delays in its planned acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems by July 31, 2024. The delay must be officially communicated through Boeing's press releases, regulatory filings, or official statements to major news outlets. A delay announcement could include, but is not limited to, postponements due to regulatory hurdles, financial complications, or other unforeseen circumstances affecting the acquisition timeline. If no such delay is announced by the specified date, or if the acquisition is completed without delays, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider unofficial reports or speculation about potential delays.
